title.value: Recommended Immunizations: Order Set
Hepatitis Immunizations
Hepatitis A Vaccine (0 and 6 to 18 Months)

textEquivalent.value: Hepatitis A vaccine 1 mL solution intramuscular 1 time give injection in the deltoid region now

title.value: Combined Hepatitis A and B Vaccine Series (0, 1, and 6 Months)

textEquivalent.value: Hepatitis A and hepatitis B (recombinant) vaccine 1 mL solution intramuscular 1 time give injection in the deltoid region now

title.value: Hepatitis B Vaccine (0, 1, and 6 Months) for Age < 20 Years

textEquivalent.value: Hepatitis B vaccine (recombinant) 10 micrograms/mL formulation 0.5 mL solution intramuscular 1 time give injection in the deltoid region now
Hepatitis B vaccine (recombinant) 20 micrograms/mL formulation 0.5 mL solution intramuscular 1 time give injection in the deltoid region now

title.value: Hepatitis B Vaccine Series (0, 1, and 6 Months) for Age >= 20 Years

description.value: Adults in the following settings are assumed to be at risk for hepatitis B virus infection and should receive a HepB series: sexually transmitted disease treatment facilities, HIV testing and treatment facilities, facilities providing drug-abuse treatment and prevention services, healthcare settings targeting services to persons who inject drugs, correctional facilities, healthcare settings targeting services to men who have sex with men, hemodialysis facilities and end-stage renal disease programs, and institutions and nonresidential day care facilities for developmentally disabled persons

textEquivalent.value: Hepatitis B vaccine (recombinant) 10 micrograms/mL formulation 1 mL solution intramuscular 1 time give injection in the deltoid region now
Hepatitis B vaccine (recombinant) 20 micrograms/mL formulation 1 mL solution intramuscular 1 time give injection in the deltoid region now

title.value: Hepatitis B Vaccine Series (0, 1, and 6 Months or 0, 1, 2, and 6 Months) for Dialysis Patients

textEquivalent.value: Hepatitis B vaccine (recombinant) 40 micrograms/mL formulation 1 mL solution intramuscular 1 time give injection in the deltoid region now
Hepatitis B vaccine (recombinant) 20 micrograms/mL formulation 2 mL solution intramuscular 1 time give injection in the deltoid region now

title.value: Herpes Zoster (Shingles) Immunization

description.value: The new version released January 2018 by the CDC https://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/volumes/67/wr/mm6703a5.htm

textEquivalent.value: Zoster vaccine live injection, powder, lyophilized 0.65 mL solution subcutaneous 1 time give injection in deltoid region now

title.value: Human Papillomavirus (HPV) Vaccine Series (0, 2, and 6 Months)

description.value: Human Papillomavirus (HPV) Vaccine CDC guidelines https://www.cdc.gov/hpv/index.html

textEquivalent.value: HPV 9-valent vaccine, recombinant injection 0.5 mL solution intramuscular 1 time give injection in the deltoid region now

title.value: Influenza Immunization

description.value: Please see ACIP’s Recommended Immunization Schedule for Adults Aged 19 Years or Older, United States, 2017 (https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/schedules/downloads/adult/adult-combined-schedule.pdf).

title.value: Standard-Dose Inactivated Influenza Vaccine (IIV)

textEquivalent.value: Influenza inactivated virus vaccine 0.5 mL solution intramuscular 1 time give injection in the deltoid region now.

title.value: Recombinant Influenza Vaccine (RIV)

textEquivalent.value: Influenza virus vaccine (recombinant) 0.5 mL solution intramuscular 1 time give injection in the deltoid region now

title.value: Intradermal IIV

textEquivalent.value: Intradermal influenza inactivated virus vaccine 0.1 mL solution intradermal 1 time give injection in the deltoid region now

title.value: High-Dose or Adjuvanted IIV

textEquivalent.value: Influenza high-dose inactivated virus vaccine 0.5 mL solution intramuscular 1 time give injection in the deltoid region now

elm:value.code: [416118004 |Administration (procedure)] ->(260686004 |Method (attribute))->[129326001 |Injection - action (qualifier value)]- ->(363701004 |Direct substance (attribute))->[408752008 |Inactivated influenza split virion vaccine (product)]- ->(410675002 |Route of administration (attribute))->[78421000 |Intramuscular route (qualifier value)]- ->(405813007 |Procedure site - Direct (attribute))->[37622008 |Deltoid region structure (body structure)];

title.value: Meningococcal Immunizations

description.value: Meningococcal vaccines should be used during pregnancy only if clearly needed. Health care providers are encouraged to register women who receive a meningococcal vaccine during pregnancy. See package inserts at: https://www.fda.gov/BiologicsBloodVaccines/Vaccines/ApprovedProducts/default.htm.

title.value: Serogroups A, C, W, and Y Conjugate Vaccine (MenACWY) Series and Boosters

description.value: CDC newly published this recommendation regarding eculizumab and meningococcal vaccination in the July 7, 2017 https://www.cdc.gov/meningococcal/clinical/eculizumab.html.

textEquivalent.value: Meningococcal (groups a, c, y, and w-135) oligosaccharide diphtheria crm197 conjugate vaccine 0.5 mL solution intramuscular 1 time give injection in the deltoid region now

title.value: Serogroup B Meningococcal Vaccine: MenB-4C Series (0 and 1 Month)

textEquivalent.value: Neisseria meningitidis serogroup b-4c protein antigen vaccine 0.5 mL solution intramuscular 1 time give injection in the deltoid region now

title.value: Serogroup B Meningococcal Vaccine: MenB-Fhbp Series (0, 1 to 2, and 6 Months or 0 and 6 Months, Based on Indications)

textEquivalent.value: Neisseria meningitidis serogroup b-FHbp protein antigen vaccine 0.5 mL solution intramuscular 1 time give injection in the deltoid region now

title.value: Measles, Mumps, and Rubella (MMR) Immunizations

description.value: Please note that ACIP published updated guidance on MMR immunizations https://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/volumes/67/wr/mm6701a7.htm

title.value: Measles, Mumps, and Rubella Vaccine Series (0 and 28 Days)

textEquivalent.value: Measles, mumps, and rubella virus vaccine live injection, powder, lyophilized 0.5 mL solution subcutaneous 1 time give injection in the deltoid region now

title.value: Measles, Mumps, and Rubella Vaccine

textEquivalent.value: Measles, mumps, and rubella virus vaccine live injection, powder, lyophilized 0.5 mL solution subcutaneous 1 time give injection in the deltoid region now

title.value: Pneumococcal Immunization

description.value: Pneumococcal Immunization CDC guidelines https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/vpd/pneumo/hcp/recommendations.html. Both Pneumococcal Polysaccharide Vaccine (PPSV23) and Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine (PCV13) should be given to a pregnant woman only if clearly needed. Pregnancy is not an absolute contraindication.

title.value: 13-Valent Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine

textEquivalent.value: Pneumococcal 13-valent conjugate vaccine 0.5 mL solution intramuscular 1 time give injection in the deltoid region now

title.value: 23-Valent Pneumococcal Polysaccharide Vaccine

textEquivalent.value: Pneumococcal polyvalent-23 vaccine 0.5 mL solution intramuscular 1 time give injection in the deltoid region now

title.value: Tetanus, Diphtheria, and Pertussis Immunization

description.value: Tetanus, Diphtheria, and Pertussis Immunization CDC Guidelines https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/vpd/dtap-tdap-td/hcp/recommendations.html

title.value: Tetanus, Diphtheria, and Pertussis Vaccine

textEquivalent.value: Tetanus toxoid, reduced diphtheria toxoid, and acellular pertussis vaccine 0.5 mL solution intramuscular 1 time give injection in the deltoid region now

title.value: Tetanus and Diphtheria Vaccine

textEquivalent.value: Tetanus and diphtheria toxoids vaccine 0.5 mL solution intramuscular 1 time give injection in the deltoid region now

title.value: Varicella Immunization

textEquivalent.value: Varicella live virus vaccine 0.5 mL solution subcutaneous 1 time give injection in the deltoid region now

title.value: Patient and Caregiver Education

textEquivalent.value: Vaccine education (patient-appropriate material regarding ordered vaccines) now
